text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 2.144.1 Capacity Policy dated November 2015 is superseded.
The Component Capacity Management Process is applicable to all ACIO (Associate Chief Information Officer) areas with responsibility for Capacity management.
Table of Contents
Program Scope and
Background
Purpose
Scope
Authority
Mandate
Management Policy
) Overview - This IRM is directed to organizations that will build, monitor, maintain, tune and upgrade components that support the businesses and and mission. (
) Purpose - To provide guidance to support the mission by efficiently the component infrastructure. (
) Audience - This process is directed to all organizations that have to monitor and maintain the component environments. (
) Policy Owner - The ACIO of Enterprise Services (ES). (
) Program Owner -Will be the Director of Solutions Engineering (SE) located within the ES ACIO organization (
) Primary Stakeholders - Will be organizations that have responsibility to maintain the IRS capacity infrastructure. (

) Program Goal - To deliver and maintain the most cost effective and capacity infrastructure( i.e., hardware, software, applications and operating systems, etc.) to the business stakeholders to help ensure their support of IRS mission is met. . (

) This policy was established to align the IRS and its Missions to follow the Industry best practice is delivering the best, and most capable IT capacity, the service in support of its Business customers. (

) This policy establishes the organizational policy for planning and the Capacity Management process to ensure that all current and future capacity and performance aspects of the Information Technology (IT) infra- structure are provided to meet business requirements at acceptable cost. Capacity Management process ensures IT infrastructure is provided at the time in the right volume at the right price, and ensures that IT is used in most efficient manner (
) This policy is applicable to all IT organizations with responsibilities for Management activities. (

) Enterprise Services is responsible for the development, implementation, maintenance, of this directive. Approval of this directive, including updates, rests with the ACIO of Enterprise Services. Any questions or updates to Policy can be directed to Enterprise Services, Front door email: SE Frontdoor:*IT Engineering Customer Support (
) All IT Organization that have responsibility for IT capacity, are to follow the Capacity Management Processes. (
) Business owners have the responsibility to obtain funding in order to their IT capacity infrastructure needs. This includes initial procurement as as maintaining needs.
Capacity Management Policy 2.144.1
Audience - This process is directed to all organizations that have responsibility to monitor and maintain the component environments.
) IT requirements development will be accurate in deploying the most cost effective way in supporting the businesses IT capacity needs (
) The procurement of IT capacity in support of the business will be of industry standard, and at the best possible cost. (
) Maintaining the IT capacity in line with service level agreements between business and IT capacity support. (
) Modernizing the IT capacity in order to support the business in the most efficient and cost effective manner.
IT requirements development will be accurate in deploying the most cost effective way in supporting the businesses IT capacity needs
